TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit ComponentSerializationService extends System.Object

summary.span: 提供用于将一组组件或可序列化的对象序列化到序列化存储区的基类。

span.span: Provides the base class for serializing a set of components or serializable objects into a serialization store.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 将一组组件或可序列化的对象序列化到序列化存储区中。The serializes a set of components or serializable objects into a serialization store. 然后, 稍后可以反序列化该存储区。The store can then be deserialized later. 类不同于其他序列化方案, 因为序列化格式是不透明的, 并且它允许对象的部分序列化。The class differs from other serialization schemes in that the serialization format is opaque, and it allows for partial serialization of objects. 例如, 您可以选择仅序列化对象的选定属性。For example, you can choose to serialize only selected properties for an object. 此类为`abstract`。This class is `abstract`. 通常, 将提供此类的具体实现, 并将其作为服务添加到其。Typically, a will provide a concrete implementation of this class and add it as a service to its . 这允许按最适合它们的格式对对象进行序列化。This allows objects to be serialized in the format best suited for them. 类将替换 .NET Framework 版本1.0 中的接口, 但保留后者以实现向后兼容性。 The class replaces the interface from the .NET Framework version 1.0, although the latter is retained for backward compatibility.

para.span: 从类继承时, 必须重写此类中的所有方法。

span.span: When you inherit from the class, you must override all the methods in this class.

para.span: 其中一些方法旨在引发异常, 如其相应主题中所述;强烈建议派生类遵循这些准则来维护操作一致性。

span.span: Some of these methods were designed to throw exceptions, as documented in their corresponding topics; it is strongly recommended that derived classes follow these guidelines to maintain consistency of operation.

para.span: 有关更多信息，请参见 类。

span.span: For more information, see the class.

span.span: Creates a new .

returns.span: 一个新创建的序列化存储区。

span.span: A new created serialization store.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 多个对象可以序列化为同一序列化存储区。Multiple objects can be serialized into the same serialization store. 完成存储后, 可以调用其或方法。When you are finished with the store, you can call its or method. 关闭后, 序列化存储区可用于反序列化, 也可以保存到流中。Once closed, a serialization store can be used for deserialization, or it can be saved into a stream. 序列化存储区可传递到各种序列化方法, 以生成一组对象的序列化状态。The serialization store can be passed to any of the various serializing methods to build up serialization state for a group of objects.

summary.span: 将给定存储区反序列化以产生一个对象集合。

span.span: Deserializes the given store to produce a collection of objects.

summary.span: 将给定存储区反序列化以产生一个对象集合。

span.span: Deserializes the given store to produce a collection of objects.

returns.span: 根据存储状态创建的对象集合。

span.span: A collection of objects created according to the stored state.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法对`store`进行反序列化以生成其中包含的对象的集合。This method deserializes `store` to produce a collection of objects contained within it. 按照序列化对象的顺序对对象进行反序列化。Objects are deserialized in the same order in which they were serialized.

span.span: The to deserialize.

param.name: container
param.span: 对象将要添加到的容器。

span.span: The container to which objects will be added.

summary.span: 将给定的 反序列化为给定的容器。

span.span: Deserializes the given to the given container.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法反序列`store`化, 但不是生成新对象, 而是将存储区中的数据应用于从提供的容器中获取的一组现有对象。 The method deserializes `store`, but instead of producing new objects, it applies the data in the store to an existing set of objects that are taken from the provided container. 因此, 调用方可以提前创建一个对象, 但它可以看到合适的对象。As a result, the caller can create in advance an object however it sees fit. 如果对象具有反序列化状态, 并且在现有对象集中没有命名该对象, 则将创建一个新的对象。If an object has a deserialization state and the object is not named in the set of existing objects, a new object will be created. 如果该对象还实现, 则会将其添加`container`到中。If that object also implements , it will be added to `container`. 容器中的对象必须具有与序列化存储区中的对象相匹配的名称和类型, 才能使用现有对象。Objects in the container must have names and types that match objects in the serialization store in order for an existing object to be used.

exception.span: 或 为 。

span.span: or is .

exception.span: 不包含任何具有序列化容器可以处理的格式的数据。

span.span: does not contain data in a format the serialization container can process.

span.span: The to which the state of will be serialized.
The object to serialize.

summary.span: 根据默认属性值序列化给定对象。

span.span: Serializes the given object, accounting for default property values.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 标准序列化是通过方法实现的, 它仅序列化不同于组件默认状态的值。Standard serialization, as implemented through the method, only serializes values that differ from the component's default state. 这将提供最简洁的序列化机制, 但假定在反序列化过程中将使用新创建的对象。This provides the most compact serialization mechanism but assumes that a newly created object will be used during deserialization. 如果使用现有对象, 则不能保证生成的反序列化对象复制序列化对象的原始状态;在反序列化过程中, 在序列化过程中包含默认值的属性将不会重置回默认值。If an existing object is used, the resulting deserialized object is not guaranteed to duplicate the original state of the serialized object; the properties that contained default values during serialization will not be reset back to their defaults during deserialization. 方法不使用此快捷方式。The method does not use this shortcut. 它会序列化源对象的所有属性, 以便反序列化可以还原所有对象的属性, 而不考虑默认状态。It serializes all properties of the source object so that deserialization can restore all the object's properties, regardless of default state. 此方法对于序列化集合特别有用, 因为集合中的构成项的顺序可能会更改。This method is particularly useful for serializing collections, because the order of the constituent items within the collection can change. 在这种情况下, 还原整个集合的原始状态的最安全过程是覆盖所有项及其原始属性值。In this circumstance, the safest process to restore the original state of the entire collection is to overwrite all the items with all their original property values.

exception.span: 或 为 。

span.span: or is .

exception.span: 已关闭，或者 不是序列化存储区的支持类型。

span.span: is closed, or is not a supported type of serialization store.

exception.span: 使用 返回的存储区。

span.span: Use a store returned by .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 对于同一对象, 可以多次调用方法,以生成序列化存储区中序列化成员的列表。The method can be invoked multiple times for the same object to build up a list of serialized members within the serialization store. 通常, 成员应为属性或事件。In general, the member should be a property or an event.

summary.span: 根据默认属性值，序列化给定对象上的给定成员。

span.span: Serializes the given member on the given object, accounting for the default property value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法会`member`序列化`owningObject`, 即使包含默认属性值也是如此。 `member` The method serializes the `member` on `owningObject`, even if `member` contains the default property value. 请注意, 对于某些成员, 如果包含默认值, 并将相同值的设置还原到成员, 则这些概念是不同的。Note that for some members, containing the default value and restoring the setting of the same value to the member are different concepts. 例如, 如果在未设置本地值时属性从父对象中继承其值, 则将值设置回属性可能不是所需的值。For example, if a property inherits its value from a parent object when no local value is set, setting the value back to the property may not be what is desired. 此方法将考虑这一点, 并将在这种情况下清除属性的状态。The method takes this into account and would clear the state of the property in this case.
